text: Hi, on this page at the bottom the "Legal Consent Options" can be sent via the API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_ajax>  Does anyone know where i can see the "consentToProcess" text ( in this example the text is"Text that gives consent to process")? I would have thought that this text is attached to the contact data, but i cannot find the text. I just see the field "Legal basis for processing contact's data-Freely given consent from contact" , but not the custom text.
What Push Notification service has anyone been able to use with HubSpot?
i believe i tested <https://onesignal.com/> and it worked before
yeah. That is the only on ei can tell that allows for custom service worker locations
has anyone any idea about the “text” option in the “LegalConsentOptions” ? i need to know were i can find this text
For clarification: it is the highlighted text that i send to HubSpot ( in addition to the other required information). I would like to know were i can see this text in HubSpot.
<@UBT0AHWLD> when the GDPR notice appears on the site have you looked through the JSON for that text?
<@U26DA9CQ0> i am sorry i don´t know if i understand that correctly. We send this text with the form submit to HubSpot through the API

we send send the consent to process and the consent to communication ( which are both part of the fields) to HubSpot. They get registered and the flag for the consent is set so, if this object is send, i don´t understand why  2 out of 3 options are being processed an the third one ( the text) is not processed in HubSpot
Oh I’m sorry I wasn’t thinking. I’m not sure exactly where that text ends up. Are the text fields in the “communications” key being processed?
yes the developer says that he gets a response with no errors
i just would like to see the text in HS. Because if we don´t have the text, well then we can tell the authorities that we have a consent, but we can not proof for what text the consent was made
if the dev on the external site,  for whatever reason, decides to change the legal text, we end um with a consent for a text that is not the same anymore and therefore the consent is invalid
Right that makes sense. <@U6W3H6YN8> any ideas?

<@U26DA9CQ0>, <@U6W3H6YN8> just to understand this. If i get a success response without an error from the API, that does mean the my text get´s stored correctly? Is this correct? So if that is the case, i would just need to find the place where it gets stored and tell my client that he can find it there.
